From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin compartīrī.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [kum.pərˈti]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [kom.pərˈti]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [kom.paɾˈtiɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -i(ɾ)
  • Hyphenation: com‧par‧tir
  • Homophone: compartí (except Valencian)

Verb

[edit]

compartir (first-person singular present comparteixo, first-person singular preterite compartí, past participle compartit)

  1. to share

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of compartir (third conjugation, with -eix-)
infinitive compartir
gerund compartint
past participle masculine feminine
singular compartit compartida
plural compartits compartides
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present comparteixo comparteixes comparteix compartim compartiu comparteixen
imperfect compartia comparties compartia compartíem compartíeu compartien
future compartiré compartiràs compartirà compartirem compartireu compartiran
preterite compartí compartires compartí compartírem compartíreu compartiren
conditional compartiria compartiries compartiria compartiríem compartiríeu compartirien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present comparteixi comparteixis comparteixi compartim compartiu comparteixin
imperfect compartís compartissis compartís compartíssim compartíssiu compartissin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — comparteix comparteixi compartim compartiu comparteixin
negative (no) — no comparteixis no comparteixi no compartim no compartiu no comparteixin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • compartició
  • compartiment

Further reading

[edit]
  • “compartir”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “compartir”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “compartir” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “compartir” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

(This etymology is missing or incomplete. Please add to it, or discuss it at the Etymology scriptorium.)

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kompaɾˈtiɾ/ [kom.paɾˈt̪iɾ]
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Hyphenation: com‧par‧tir

Verb

[edit]

compartir (first-person singular present comparto, first-person singular preterite compartín, past participle compartido)

  1. to divide (up)

Occitan

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
This entry needs pronunciation information. If you are familiar with the IPA then please add some!

Verb

[edit]

compartir

  1. to divide (up)
  2. to share (out)

Conjugation

[edit]

gerund compartissent ?ent compartit

conditional 2nd form1 compartiguèra compartiguèras compartiguèra compartigueram compartigueratz compartiguèran

imperative — tu — nosautres vosautres —
compartís compartiscam compartissetz 1Now chiefly obsolete, still in use in some Limousin and Vivaro-Alpin dialects

Derived terms

[edit]
  • compartiment

Further reading

[edit]
  • Diccionari General de la Lenga Occitana‎[1], L’Academia occitana – Consistòri del Gai Saber, 2008-2025, page 182

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

(This etymology is missing or incomplete. Please add to it, or discuss it at the Etymology scriptorium.)

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.paʁˈt͡ʃi(ʁ)/ [kõ.pahˈt͡ʃi(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.paʁˈt͡ʃi(ʁ)/ [kõ.pahˈt͡ʃi(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /kõ.paɾˈt͡ʃi(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /kõ.paʁˈt͡ʃi(ʁ)/ [kõ.paχˈt͡ʃi(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.paɻˈt͡ʃi(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.pɐɾˈtiɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.pɐɾˈtiɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.pɐɾˈti.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: com‧par‧tir

Verb

[edit]

compartir (first-person singular present comparto, first-person singular preterite comparti, past participle compartido) (transitive)

  1. to share (divide into compartments)
  2. to share (divide for oneself and for others)
    Synonym: compartilhar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of compartir (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person

Related terms

Further reading

[edit]
  • “compartir” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “compartir”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “compartir”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin compartī, present passive infinitive of compartior.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kompaɾˈtiɾ/ [kõm.paɾˈt̪iɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: com‧par‧tir

Verb

[edit]

compartir (first-person singular present comparto, first-person singular preterite compartí, past participle compartido)

  1. to share
  2. to split, to divide (in order to share)
  3. to pool (e.g. resources)
  4. to compartmentalize

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of compartir (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive compartir
gerund compartiendo
past participle masculine feminine
singular compartido compartida
plural compartidos compartidas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
